title: my new email accounts added disapear when i shut down Thunderbird

I added another accounts (many times) and if I shut down Thunderbird, when i reopen the new accounts is disapeard, no more existing. I added again and the same situation. I found a same question on this forum from 2023 but was archived without a reply. Thanks for someoane help!

title: deactivate email account without deleting
content:
This article describes the issue but there is no resolution that works in all cases https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1323864

In my situation I have a work account that uses gmail as the mail server. every time I open TB I get this message popping up.

I have disabled all fetching of email and notifications of incoming mail and deleted related passwords.

Is there any way to fully disable an account without deleting it?
creator: developerchris1

title: I can no longer send email.  What is a secure mail key?
content: Thunderbird. I have been using it successfully for 14 years. Now I can no longer send email. I have 6 email accounts (gmail, outlook, yahoo, att, etc.) and all receive email. Outgoing mail and saving a draft time out and fail. The yahoo account asks for my password, but does not accept it. (It is correct because I can access that account without using the thunderbird client. What is a secure mail key? I seem to have one at least for one of my accounts, but I don't know what do to with it.
creator: carolyoung47

title: opening the subdirectories of an email account
content: My Thunderbird accesses three different email accounts that I have. Two of those accounts have easily accessible subdirectories (e.g. Inbox, Drafts, Sent Mail ...) whereas my main email account (bsheppard@lisco.com) has no obvious way to access ANY subdirectory. What to do???
